keyword: how many calories in sweet potato french fries
title: How Many Calories in Sweet Potato French Fries?
meta_description: Discover how many calories in sweet potato french fries per 100g, including carbs, protein, fat, and nutrition breakdowns with tweaks for baked versions.
h1: How Many Calories in Sweet Potato French Fries?
assumptions: Deep-fried in vegetable oil, salted; based on standard frozen sweet potato fries.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by brand, oil type, frying method, portion size, and added seasonings. Check labels when available.

quick_answer.text: 100g of sweet potato french fries has about 220 kcal, with 30g carbs and 2g protein.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

faqs.q: How many calories in 100g sweet potato french fries?
faqs.a: Approximately 220 kcal for deep-fried sweet potato french fries.

faqs.q: Are sweet potato french fries healthier than regular?
faqs.a: They offer more fiber and vitamins but similar calories if fried; baking reduces fat.

faqs.q: What are the carbs in sweet potato french fries?
faqs.a: About 30g carbs per 100g, including 4g fiber and 8g sugars.

faqs.q: How does baking affect calories in sweet potato fries?
faqs.a: Baked versions have ~140 kcal per 100g, lower due to less oil absorption.

faqs.q: What's the protein content in sweet potato french fries?
faqs.a: Roughly 2g protein per 100g, mainly from the sweet potato.
